alert.note: Alert for Audubon; Guthrie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:42AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GUTHRIE AND CENTRAL AUDUBON COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM CDT... At 541 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Audubon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Audubon and Audubon County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
